Useful docs on URIs, httpRange-14, conneg, etc.

Jan 27, 2017

Creating proper URIs for information and non-information resources, and designing a system arcquitecture accordingly is a messy business. Some pointers for future reference:

  • https://www.w3.org/2001/tag/issues.html#httpRange-14
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/cooluris/
  • https://github.com/perma-id/w3id.org
  • https://www.w3.org/Provider/Style/URI.html
  • https://www.w3.org/wiki/GoodURIs
  • https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/designing-uri-sets-for-the-uk-public-sector
  • https://data.gov.uk/resources/uris
  • http://philarcher.org/diary/2013/uripersistence/
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/ (Data quality model!)
  • https://www.w3.org/2001/sw/hcls/notes/hcls-rdf-guide/
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/ld-bp/
  • http://www.aenor.es/aenor/normas/normas/fichanorma.asp?tipo=N&codigo=N0054318#.WIoD01PhCM8
  • https://www.boe.es/diario_boe/txt.php?id=BOE-A-2013-2380
  • http://richard.cyganiak.de/blog/2008/03/what-is-your-rdf-browsers-accept-header/
  • https://httpd.apache.org/docs/trunk/content-negotiation.html#better
  • http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/content-negotiation.html
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/ldp/
  • http://docs.rdf4j.org/rest-api/#_content_types
  • http://linkeddatabook.com/editions/1.0/
  • http://www.springer.com/us/book/9781461417668
  • https://www.amazon.com/Linked-Data-Structured-Web/dp/1617290394
  • https://logd.tw.rpi.edu/instance-hub-uri-design
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/webarch/
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Content_negotiation/List_of_default_Accept_values#Values_for_an_image
  • https://www.w3.org/blog/2006/02/content-negotiation/
  • https://www.w3.org/Consortium/Persistence
